ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: American PowerNet Management, LP Rate Schedule FERC No.1

record_data.record_plain_text:
POWER SALES AT NEGOTIATED RATES TARIFF MBR-1 OF AMERICAN POWERNET MANAGEMENT, LP
AMERICAN POWERNET MANAGEMENT, LP RATE SCHEDULE FERC NO. 1 1. Availability: American PowerNet Management, LP (???APN???) makes electric energy and capacity and ancillary services available under this Rate Schedule to any purchaser for resale. 2. Applicability: This Rate Schedule is applicable to all sales of energy and capacity by APN not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule of APN. 3. Ancillary Services: APN may sell the following ancillary services to Buyer under this Tariff from time to time at rates, terms and conditions established by the agreement of the Parties. All such Transactions shall be voluntary. a. ISO New England: APN offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England Inc. b. PJM: APN offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. c. NYISO: APN offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. d. CAISO: APN offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation (???CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. e. Third-Party Ancillary Services: APN offers Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers. 4. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and APN. 5. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and APN. 6. Affiliate Sales Prohibited: No sale shall be made pursuant to this Rate Schedule to any public utility with a franchised electric service territory that is controlled by, or under common control with, or controlling APN. 7. Mitigated Sales: Sales of energy and capacity are permissible under this tariff in all balancing authority areas where the APN has been granted market-based rate authority. Sales of energy and capacity under this tariff are also permissible at the metered boundary between the APN???s mitigated balancing authority areas and a balancing authority area where the APN has been granted market-based rate authority provided: (i) legal title of the power sold transfers at the metered boundary of the balancing authority areas; (ii) any power sold hereunder is not intended to serve load in the seller???s mitigated market; and (iii) no affiliate of the mitigated seller will sell the same power back into the mitigated seller???s mitigated market. APN must retain, for a period of five years from the date of the sale, all data and information related to the sale that demonstrates compliance with items (i), (ii) and (iii) above. 8. Compliance With the Commission???s Regulations: APN shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR or Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the seller's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning seller's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 9. Waivers And Authorizations: APN is exempted from the requirements of Subparts B and C of part 35, except sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; (2) Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission's regulations concerning accounting and reporting requirements with the exception of 18 C.F.R. ?? 141.14 and 141.15; and (3) blanket authorization under Part 34 of the Commission regulations for all future issuances of securities and assumptions of liability. American Powernet Management, Inc., Docket No. No. ER03-769-001, June 6, 2003, unpublished letter order. 10. Seller Category: APN is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a).
